item.title: Sparse set in Go
item.description: This post is inspired by https://research.swtch.com/sparse Complete code: https://github.com/ideahitme/go-and-learn/blob/master/golang/cgo/sparse.go Implementing data structures in Go is easy due to the presence of slices and maps which allows data structures like queue, stack programmed in just few lines of code. Implementing sets should not be too difficult either, but let’s take a closer look at two different ways of doing it. First is the most commonly seen implementation via map and the other will utilize an interesting data structure called sparse set.
